definition: clown/2nd earthly branch: 1-3 a.m., 12th solar month (6th January to 3rd February), year of the Ox/ancient Chinese compass point: 30°
role (theater)/to compete/ancient three legged wine vessel/third note of pentatonic scale
angle/corner/horn/horn-shaped/unit of money equal to 0.1 yuan, or 10 cents (a dime)/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Like the sad eyes on the face of a clown.
sentences.chinese: 像个丑角的脸上可怜的双眼。

sentences.english: Buffoons play an important role to relax audience.
sentences.chinese: 丑角是让观众放松的重要角色。

sentences.english: It's two sides of the play: the clowns and the lovers. And to do this play right, you have to balance.
sentences.chinese: 这部戏有两个主要的方面，丑角们和恋人们。

sentences.english: Ma Shizeng plays the protagonist, Song Shijie, a clown role in that film.
sentences.chinese: 马师曾在剧中扮演主角宋世杰，即该剧中的一个丑角。

sentences.english: Feste is the clown in Twelfth-Night.
sentences.chinese: 菲斯特是《第十二夜》中的丑角。

sentences.english: Each clown capped the last joke of the other.
sentences.chinese: 丑角的笑话一个比一个好。

sentences.english: We bleeped the comedian's obscene lines.
sentences.chinese: 我们用哔哔声消除丑角式人物的污秽的台词。

sentences.english: At the circus, the clowns mopped and mowed.
sentences.chinese: 马戏演出时，丑角扮怪相。

sentences.english: "They are drawing their inner buffoon, " explains the teacher.
sentences.chinese: “他们在描绘自己内心的丑角，”老师解释说。

definition: dan, female roles in Chinese opera (traditionally played by specialized male actors)
(Chinese opera) to play a role outside of one's specialty/(modern) to play a transvestite role/to masquerade as an opponent
to develop/to evolve/to practice/to perform/to play/to act
female military role in a Chinese opera
funny man (lead role in comic dialogue 對口相聲|对口相声[dui4 kou3 xiang4 sheng1])/to joke/to play the fool/to provoke laughter
(Chinese opera) tongchui hualian, a military character holding a bronze mace, classified as a jing 淨|净[jing4] role
